required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of Safety and Efficacy for the Relieva Stratus With Elution of Triamcinolone Acetonide
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of Safety and Efficacy for the Relieva Stratus With Elution of Triamcinolone Acetonide (Kenalog-40)

brief_summary.textblock:
Study Design:
A non-randomized, multi-center, prospective, clinical study intended to evaluate the safety and efficacy of treating the ethmoid sinuses with the Ethmoid Sinus Spacer and Access System used for the local delivery of Triamcinolone Acetonide, over a period of 28 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Intrapatient Change in Ethmoid Lund-MacKay CT Score (Ethmoid Score Only) at 10 Weeks Post-procedure Compared to Baseline.
primary_outcome.description: The Lund-MacKay (LMK) CT (computed tomography) scoring system is used to evaluate radiographic opacification of the paranasal sinuses, an indicator of sinus disease. The LMK scoring system rates each of both the left and right frontal, maxillary, sphenoid, ostiomeatal complex, anterior ethmoid and posterior ethmoid sinuses on a scale of 0 to 2, where '0' is 'no opacification' and '2' is 'complete opacification'. For this study endpoint, only the ethmoid sinus scores will be evaluated and totaled (left and right anterior and posterior ethmoid sinuses) where zero is the minimum score, and 8 is the maximum score. A higher score represents greater sinus disease burden. The LMK score will be evaluated at 10 weeks post-procedure compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Decrease in Vision Greater Than 2 Lines Per Snellen Chart (BCVA at Baseline vs. BCVA 10 Week Post-procedure)
secondary_outcome.description: The Snellen eye chart will be used to evaluate participant's best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA, or best distance vision with eyeglasses or contact lenses) at baseline and at 10 week post-procedure. The number of participants with a decrease in vision greater than 2 lines per the Snellen eye chart are reported for this study endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Either a Change in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) ≥10mmHg OR Documented IOP > 21 mmHg
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Intra-Ocular Pressure (IOP) of ≥ 10mmHg or documented IOP of > 21 mmHg were considered clinically significant (baseline compared to 10 weeks post-procedure).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Intra-patient Change in SNOT-20 Score Post-procedure Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The 20 question Sino-Nasal Outcome Test (SNOT-20) will be used to evaluate sinus symptoms and sinus-symptom related quality of life (QOL) at baseline, 10 weeks, and 1 year post-procedure. The change in SNOT-20 score at each post-procedure time point will be evaluated compared to baseline SNOT-20 score. Each of the 20 questions in the SNOT-20 survey is scored on a scale of 0 to 5, where '0' represents 'no problem' and '5' represents 'problem as bad as it can be'. The 20 questions are expressed as a mean of the scores. Therefore, the minimum mean score is zero and the maximum mean score is 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Intra-patient Change in SNOT-20 Score Post-procedure Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The 20 question Sino-Nasal Outcome Test (SNOT-20) will be used to evaluate sinus symptoms and sinus-symptom related quality of life (QOL) at baseline, 10 weeks, and 1 year post-procedure. The change in SNOT-20 score at each post-procedure time point will be evaluated compared to baseline SNOT-20 score. Each of the 20 questions in the SNOT-20 survey is scored on a scale of 0 to 5, where '0' represents 'no problem' and '5' represents 'problem as bad as it can be'. The 20 questions are expressed as a mean of the scores. Therefore, the minimum mean score is zero and the maximum mean score is 5.

arm_group.description: Temporary implantation of Ethmoid spacer with Triamcinolone Acetonide for 28 days.

intervention.description: The Spacer is inserted surgically into the ethmoid complex through the use of a sinus access system. Triamcinolone acetonide will be administered into the Spacer for this investigational study. The Spacer will be left in the ethmoid sinus for a period of 28 days. At the end of the implant period, the device is removed with standard instrumentation, during a follow-up office visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects age 17 years or older
- Radiographic evidence of ethmoid disease (baseline CT scan obtained within 30 days of scheduled surgery)
- Diagnosis of chronic sinusitis and failed medical management (minimum of 3 weeks of antibiotics)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 17 years old
- History of glaucoma or diagnosis of glaucoma (baseline visual exam indicating IOP >21 mmHg)
- Adequate anatomical distances for treatment
- Patient received oral steroid treatment within two weeks prior to day of surgery
- Radiographic evidence of extensive sinonasal osteoneogenesis which could prevent device placement
- Sinonasal tumors or obstructive lesions
- History of facial trauma that distorts sinus anatomy and precludes access to the ethmoid sinus
- Contracted/underdeveloped ethmoid sinus
- Dehiscent lamina orbitalis
- Previous ethmoid surgery
- Ethmoid mucocele
- Extensive Nasal Polyps
- Asthmatic patients with aspirin sensitivity
- Pregnant or lactating females

group.title: Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer
group.description: Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer: Temporary implantation of the Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer in the ethmoid sinuses with triamcinolone acetonide for a period of 28 days.

participants_list.participants: Follow-up extended to 1 yr. 13 subjects chose not to participate in the extension.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not consent for extended follow-up

group.title: Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer
group.description: Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer: Temporary implantation of the Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer in the ethmoid sinuses with triamcinolone acetonide for a period of 28 days

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Mean Intrapatient Change in Ethmoid Lund-MacKay CT Score (Ethmoid Score Only) at 10 Weeks Post-procedure Compared to Baseline.
outcome.description: The Lund-MacKay (LMK) CT (computed tomography) scoring system is used to evaluate radiographic opacification of the paranasal sinuses, an indicator of sinus disease. The LMK scoring system rates each of both the left and right frontal, maxillary, sphenoid, ostiomeatal complex, anterior ethmoid and posterior ethmoid sinuses on a scale of 0 to 2, where '0' is 'no opacification' and '2' is 'complete opacification'. For this study endpoint, only the ethmoid sinus scores will be evaluated and totaled (left and right anterior and posterior ethmoid sinuses) where zero is the minimum score, and 8 is the maximum score. A higher score represents greater sinus disease burden. The LMK score will be evaluated at 10 weeks post-procedure compared to baseline.
outcome.population: A total of 58 of the 63 subjects had paired baseline and 10 week post-procedure CT scans available for analysis.

measure.title: Mean Intrapatient Change in Ethmoid Lund-MacKay CT Score (Ethmoid Score Only) at 10 Weeks Post-procedure Compared to Baseline.
measure.description: The Lund-MacKay (LMK) CT (computed tomography) scoring system is used to evaluate radiographic opacification of the paranasal sinuses, an indicator of sinus disease. The LMK scoring system rates each of both the left and right frontal, maxillary, sphenoid, ostiomeatal complex, anterior ethmoid and posterior ethmoid sinuses on a scale of 0 to 2, where '0' is 'no opacification' and '2' is 'complete opacification'. For this study endpoint, only the ethmoid sinus scores will be evaluated and totaled (left and right anterior and posterior ethmoid sinuses) where zero is the minimum score, and 8 is the maximum score. A higher score represents greater sinus disease burden. The LMK score will be evaluated at 10 weeks post-procedure compared to baseline.
measure.population: A total of 58 of the 63 subjects had paired baseline and 10 week post-procedure CT scans available for analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Decrease in Vision Greater Than 2 Lines Per Snellen Chart (BCVA at Baseline vs. BCVA 10 Week Post-procedure)
outcome.description: The Snellen eye chart will be used to evaluate participant's best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA, or best distance vision with eyeglasses or contact lenses) at baseline and at 10 week post-procedure. The number of participants with a decrease in vision greater than 2 lines per the Snellen eye chart are reported for this study endpoint.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes paired data for 53 subjects with baseline and 10 week visual acuity data available for analysis.

measure.population: The analysis population includes paired data for 53 subjects with baseline and 10 week visual acuity data available for analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Either a Change in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) ≥10mmHg OR Documented IOP > 21 mmHg
outcome.description: Change in Intra-Ocular Pressure (IOP) of ≥ 10mmHg or documented IOP of > 21 mmHg were considered clinically significant (baseline compared to 10 weeks post-procedure).
outcome.population: The analysis population includes paired data for 53 of the 63 subjects with intraocular pressure (IOP) evaluations available for analysis.

group.title: Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer
group.description: Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer: Temporary implantation of the Stratus Microflow Ethmoid Spacer in the ethmoid sinuses with triamcinolone acetonide for a period of 28 days

measure.title: Number of Participants With Either a Change in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) ≥10mmHg OR Documented IOP > 21 mmHg
measure.description: Change in Intra-Ocular Pressure (IOP) of ≥ 10mmHg or documented IOP of > 21 mmHg were considered clinically significant (baseline compared to 10 weeks post-procedure).
measure.population: The analysis population includes paired data for 53 of the 63 subjects with intraocular pressure (IOP) evaluations available for analysis.

outcome.title: Mean Intra-patient Change in SNOT-20 Score Post-procedure Compared to Baseline
outcome.description: The 20 question Sino-Nasal Outcome Test (SNOT-20) will be used to evaluate sinus symptoms and sinus-symptom related quality of life (QOL) at baseline, 10 weeks, and 1 year post-procedure. The change in SNOT-20 score at each post-procedure time point will be evaluated compared to baseline SNOT-20 score. Each of the 20 questions in the SNOT-20 survey is scored on a scale of 0 to 5, where '0' represents 'no problem' and '5' represents 'problem as bad as it can be'. The 20 questions are expressed as a mean of the scores. Therefore, the minimum mean score is zero and the maximum mean score is 5.
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of the 47 subjects with 1 year post-procedure SNOT-20 scores.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
